comments.content:
Like I alluded to in another thread, I think you need to get into grayscale bitmap fonts to really achieve the type of thing that seems to turn you on. The level of detail you're trying to put in such limited space might be requiring too much wishful thinking at the expense of real legibility.   
   
hhp

hey hrant,   
   
i tried out bitfonter, and, well, they problem with grayscale bitmap fonts are a plenty   
   
1) they don't work with photoshop, at least on a mac   
   
2) they are gray, not semi-transparent, so you can only use white backgrounds   
   
they do work on the mac though...

I'm having a "fatal" problem with it too (although it has to do with the Windows OS directly). But the transparency stuff you're supposed to be able to do with something they're calling Photofonts.   
   
Anyway, what I've done is send my files to them, with a detailed explanation of what's not working. I'm hopeful, because Pyrus's responsiveness in terms of features/bugs is legendary.   
   
hhp

I'm looking at that thing called photofonts...WTH is it? looking on the web there is a weird program that embeds images in type called photofonts, but i've never heard of it before. a WIN only thing? \*If\* you could do photoshop with it, that would be half the battle, but then you couldn't use it with Flash (Flash doesn't \*do\* bitmap fonts)

and "Photon Fonts" shows up when I look for the .phf extension - [http://qdn.qnx.com/support/docs/neutrino/utilities/p/phfont.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414200703/http:/qdn.qnx.com/support/docs/neutrino/utilities/p/phfont.html)
